english: long; length; lasting; for a long time

etymology.description: pictogram: an old man with long hair; simplified from 長 (ancient variant 镸).
etymology.interpretation: Originally depicted an elder with long hair, linking physical length to the idea of being long or lasting. The streamlined simplified form 长 preserves the notion of extension in space or time.
etymology.simplification: Stroke reduction of 長 to 长, removing the hair-like details and standardizing the form for ease and speed of writing.

examples.chinese: 这条河很长(這條河很長)。
我们等了很长时间(我們等了很長時間)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen děng le hěn cháng shíjiān.
examples.english: We waited for a long time.

examples.chinese: 长期计划需要耐心(長期計劃需要耐心)。
